author: USA TODAY
title: UCLA's mascot moons FT shooter
text:

Post to Facebook UCLA's mascot moons FT shooter There was a moon over the UCLA-Oregon game. Posted!   Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs UCLA's mascot moons FT shooter Charles Curtis , USA TODAY 9:15 a.m. ET Feb. 10, 2017 3 Shares 
LOUISVILLE, KY - MARCH 19: The UCLA Bruins mascot during the second round of the 2015 NCAA Men's Basketball Tournamenat at the KFC YUM! Center on March 19, 2015 in Louisville, Kentucky. (Photo by Joe Robbins/Getty Images) ORG XMIT: 527065557 ORIG FILE ID: 466916714 (Photo: Getty Images) 
Did everyone see the full moon over Thursday night's UCLA-Oregon tilt? 
Here it is! — Rob PeLLez (@World_Wide_Wob) February 10, 2017 
The Bruins mascot worked his, er, tail off to distract an Oregon player shooting a free throw with under 20 seconds to play and UCLA up by just two. 
The bad news: It didn't work out at the moment - the Ducks' Jordan Bell hit his free throw. The good news? UCLA won anyway, although perhaps the Bruins should think about hiring Green Man from It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia to do the dirty work under the hoop. He's pretty effective.
